definition[0]: a reduction in the price of something
definition[1]: the act of reducing the price of something, or the amount by which the price is reduced
example[1]: The retailer’s losses come from clearance markdowns of goods.
definition[2]: a fall in the price of shares, bonds etc
example[2]: a $200 million markdown of a high-risk portfolio of shares of start-up companies
example[3]: Creditors will have to take big markdowns (=accept them) from the face value of their bonds.
definition[3]: a reduction in the RATING of bonds etc (=estimate of the risk that they will not be repaid)
example[4]: the rating agency’s markdown of the company’s commercial paper
